SEARCH
Package utils

Class MailUtils

java.lang.Object
utils.MailUtils
public class MailUtils extends Object
Utility class for sending emails using the SMTP protocol with a Gmail account. This class configures and sends emails to one or multiple recipients.

References for sending email in Java:

  • Sending Email in Java: https://javatpoint.com/example-of-sending-email-using-java-mail-api
  • JavaMail Example - Send Mail in Java using SMTP: https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/javamail-example-send-mail-in-java-smtp
Author:
Shuting Wang

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • sendEmail

      public static boolean sendEmail(Set<String> emails, String title, String content)
      Sends an email to the specified list of recipients. This method configures and sends an email using the SMTP protocol. It supports sending emails to multiple recipients.
      Parameters:
      emails - A Set of target email addresses to whom the email will be sent. Cannot be null or empty.
      title - The title (subject) of the email. Cannot be null.
      content - The content (body) of the email, which can include HTML. Cannot be null.
      Returns:
      true if the email was sent successfully; false otherwise.
